column5: I fished Zizania many years ago and walleye fishing was unreal. Also huge northerns.
just hide deep in the bush when they come ! They wont look for ya that long !
That's a waste of fuel to come back,they don't need to bother,times are tough save the fuel.

We didn't get anything big the other day 18 "about the biggest but have caught 28" there and a 40" pike.So there in there.right now in most lakes there are so many smaller fish tgat are wa√Ω more aggressive than larger ones and they sworm on your bait.
That's a good problem when they fight to see who can get to the bait first,we have that same problem here in MN,hahaha
Definatly a good thing.Makes for a action packed day
Most of the swarming here john occurs at the buffets in the casino,it's a hot bite.
Oh ok.thought you were talking about good fishing there.

Today felt good flying into Zizania Lake with 2 guests from Toronto for the day.The fishing there was insane as usuall.Lots of smoke everywhere from the fires.My 2 guests had never fished so today was a real experience for them and they learned real fast.caught to many to keep track of but I know I put around 12 doz minnows in the bag this morning and they were gone when we went to dock to get ready to be picked up a 3.Few dead ones floating in minnow bucket were used off the dock and those were gone in minutes.Water temps near 80 F so getting hot.No relieve in sight with hot weather or any rain in forecast.Bad situation.
Will you tell us a bit about the fires? Thanks
Fires all over nwo especially north of red lake. Smoke also coming from north of kenora and the western provinces.wete burning up.no rain for a long time.
Ontario needs the Americans,we always bring foul weather along on our trips,so read this Doug F

Quote: Originally Posted by EckohltQuote: Originally Posted by prov1800Today felt good flying into Zizania Lake with 2 guests from Toronto for the day.The fishing there was insane as usuall.Lots of smoke everywhere from the fires.My 2 guests had never fished so today was a real experience for them and they learned real fast.caught to many to keep track of but I know I put around 12 doz minnows in the bag this morning and they were gone when we went to dock to get ready to be picked up a 3.Few dead ones floating in minnow bucket were used off the dock and those were gone in minutes.Water temps near 80 F so getting hot.No relieve in sight with hot weather or any rain in forecast.Bad situation.Gotta be the F minnowsDefinatly helped.
Beaver leaving after dropping us off
Next time I get dropped off by a floatplane I'm going to tell the pilot,,,(don't ever come back)
Haha.Funny Rod.Wouldn't that be nice to spend a summer at a outpost.
